question:
In some countries young people are encouraged to work or travel for a year between finishing high school and starting university.

What are the advantages and disadvantages of this?
text: Many youngsters are urged to take a term off to work or study before they start tertiary studies. This essay will illustrate both the benefits and drawbacks of taking a gap year.

There are many advantages to taking a break after high school. To begin with, a preference to take a cut range can lead to better real life experiences and career selection. For instance, in this time, young people can travel to a number of places around the world; as a result, this would allow them to experience various cultures and to explore their knowledge. Moreover, some youngsters also prefer to work during this time. This would help them to showcase their skills as well as to choose a right career path. For example, many software engineers believe that it was easy for them to choose a specific software development course after they worked in the IT industry.

However, for every positive there is a negative, the flip side of taking a rift portion is being a year behind academically. This means starting one's university program a period later and graduating a span later than one's peers. In addition, there might be some financial drawbacks. For example, some scholarships do not allow students to defer so the decision of taking a gap term might be at the loss of a  scholarship. Thus, the disadvantages of a different section need to be weighed up against the advantages.

To sum up, this essay weighed that taking a break to travel or work in between  high school and university can be beneficial for personal and professional development. On the other hand, it can delay academic progress by one segment. Both the positives and negatives need to be considered before making a decision.
